text: Charles Mingus Jr. (April 22, 1922 â€“ January 5, 1979) was an American jazz musician and writer. He helped to create improvisational jazz. People say he is one of the best jazz musicians and music writers to ever live.McGlynn, D. (1997). Charles Mingus: Triumph of the Underdog. Shanachie. He played jazz music for over thirty years. He also played with other famous jazz musicians, such as Louis Armstrong, Herbie Hancock and Dizzy Gillespie. == References == Category:1922 births Category:1979 deaths Category:American jazz musicians Charles Mingus was very good at jazz. He had many struggles throughout his life, and he had to deal with racism while struggling with his family.
title: Charles Mingus
